definition: to arrange/to line up/file/series/(in data tables) column/(Tw) row
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: The staff are getting the public carriages ready for a knees-up later in the evening.
sentences.chinese: 列车员们在整理公共车厢，准备晚上的庆典。

sentences.english: Soon after the train was underway, the conductor walked through the car, checking tickets.
sentences.chinese: 火车开动后不久，列车员就到车厢里来检票了。

sentences.english: No problem, the conductress will show you.
sentences.chinese: 没问题，这女列车员会告诉您的。

sentences.english: To recognise my direction, her signing pen gives a line on my ticket.
sentences.chinese: 列车员用签字笔，在车票正面划了一道。

sentences.english: An arm stretches out from the bathroom and the conductor takes the proffered ticket.
sentences.chinese: 一只拿着票的手从里面伸出来，列车员拿着票离开了。

sentences.english: There were the smartly uniformed provodnitsas (train attendants) standing territorially by their carriage doors while they scrutinised tickets.
sentences.chinese: 穿着漂亮制服的列车员站在自己车厢门前检票。

sentences.english: Because I thought you were the trainman, and Ihaven't even got a ticket.
sentences.chinese: 因为我以为你是列车员，而我没有买车票。

sentences.english: Conclusion The railway train waiters fatigue is obv…
sentences.chinese: 结论铁路列车员疲劳状况明显。

sentences.english: You can hide under my seat when the conductor comes to check the tickets.
sentences.chinese: 当列车员来查票时，你可以藏在我的坐位下面。

sentences.english: After my wife presented her ticket, the conductor asked for the rabbits' tickets.
sentences.chinese: 我太太出示了车票，列车员又向她索要兔子的车票。

sentences.english: When the conductor came to check the tickets.
sentences.chinese: 当这个列车员来查票时你可以躲藏在我的座位下面。

sentences.english: Our attendant came round to lock all the windows against dust.
sentences.chinese: 列车员关上了所有车窗防止尘土侵入车厢。

sentences.english: He ran up to the conductor and began to shout at him.
sentences.chinese: 他跑到列车员那儿，冲他大叫大嚷起来。

definition: attendant on an airplane, train, boat etc
service (on a train, a plane etc)
to buy or upgrade a ticket after boarding a train, boat etc/to buy a ticket for a show after having sat down in the theater
to inspect a ticket/to examine a ballot
green train (slow, noisy, unairconditioned train with forest green livery and yellow trim that ran on the Chinese railway system from the 1950s, phased out in the early 21st century)
